WHY SÃO PAULO?

WHAT?

WHEN?

HOW?

WHY?

A website about my favorite place

February 2014 - May 2014

HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript, PHP, MySQL

A project for my Web II course

IT'S NOT ONLY ABOUT THE CODE

Why São Paulo? was a project created for my Web II course at Rochester Institute of Technology. It was developed in two steps. The first was only the static pages with HTML and CSS. The second one included JavaScript (with no libraries!), PHP and MySQL. My main focus was on good usability, well-structured and clean code.

I chose São Paulo as my favorite place first because it's a city very close to my hometown, Sorocaba, and second because most of my classmates had never been to Brazil. It was a great choice because it has a lot of attractions and was a great opportunity to show a little bit of Brazil to everyone else.

VISIT WHY SÃO PAULO?

LEAVE ME A COMMENT!

One feature that is not very usual for websites is to leave a comment (unless it's a blog or a news website). But on the Comments page you can leave me a comment. It is stored on a MySQL table which is updated and displayed on the website everytime a new entry is submitted.

DON'T FORGET TO VISIT WHY SÃO PAULO!
